answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Nausea, dizziness, headaches, burning in the chest is quite suggestive of GERD or gastroesophageal reflux disease.This occurs due to regurgitation of acidic stomach contents in the esophagus. I would suggest you to eat a soft bland diet for few days. Completely avoid fatty fried food, drink loads of water and eat fresh fruits and vegetables.You can also take OTC antacids before meals. Hopefully your symptoms will resolve.Do keep us posted!

question: Im a healthy 29 year old girl and over the past couple of months have been experiencing a range of agonizing symptoms.I have chronic light headness and feels like Im going to faint. I get occasional headaches. A lot of burning in my chest especially after I eat. My feet are always cold...seems like poor circulation.  I occasionally get nausea but never vomit.Its the lightheadness that is worrying me. I have never experienced this before. Please help.I've had blood work urine tests, diabetes test everything comes back normal. My blood pressure is always bang on, as is my  oxygen levels and heart rate.Anyone have any clues..... Thanks
title: Help....always light Headed
